Structs/TxConfig.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCo.name: init(sipUser:password:ringtone:ringBackTone:logLevel:)
Structs/TxConfig.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCo.abstract: Constructor of the Telnyx SDK configuration: Login using sip user and password.

Structs/TxConfig.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCo.name: init(token:ringtone:ringBackTone:logLevel:)
Structs/TxConfig.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCo.abstract: Constructor of the Telnyx SDK configuration: Login using a token.

Structs/TxCallInfo.html.name: TxCallInfo
Structs/TxCallInfo.html.abstract: TxCallInfo contains the required information of the current Call

Structs/TxConfig.html.name: TxConfig
Structs/TxConfig.html.abstract: This structure is intended to used for Telnyx SDK configurations.

Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.name: onSocketConnected()
Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.abstract: Tells the delegate when the Telnyx Client has successfully connected to the Telnyx Backend

Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.name: onSocketDisconnected()
Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.abstract: Tells the delegate when the Telnyx Client has disconnected from the Telnyx Backend

Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.name: onClientError(error:)
Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.abstract: Tells the delegate when there’s an error in the Telnyx Client

Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.name: onClientReady()
Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.abstract: Tells the delegate that the The Telnyx Client is ready to be used.

Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.name: onSessionUpdated(sessionId:)
Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.abstract: Tells the delegate that the Telnyx Client session has been updated.

Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.name: onCallStateUpdated(callState:callId:)
Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.abstract: Tells the delegate that a call has been updated.

Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.name: onIncomingCall(call:)
Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.abstract: Tells the delegate that someone is calling

Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.name: onRemoteCallEnded(callId:)
Protocols/TxClientDelegate.html#/s:9Teln.abstract: Tells the delegate that a call has ended

Enums/CallState.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC9CallS.name: NEW
Enums/CallState.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC9CallS.abstract: New call has been created in the client.

Enums/CallState.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC9CallS.name: CONNECTING
Enums/CallState.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC9CallS.abstract: The outbound call is being sent to the server.

Enums/CallState.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC9CallS.name: RINGING
Enums/CallState.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC9CallS.abstract: Call is pending to be answered. Someone is attempting to call you.

Enums/CallState.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC9CallS.name: ACTIVE
Enums/CallState.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC9CallS.abstract: Call is active when two clients are fully connected.

Enums/LogLevel.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8LogLev.name: none
Enums/LogLevel.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8LogLev.abstract: Disable logs. SDK logs will not printed. This is the default configuration.

Enums/LogLevel.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8LogLev.name: verto
Enums/LogLevel.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8LogLev.abstract: Print verto messages. Incoming and outgoing verto messages are printed.

Enums/TxError/ServerErrorReason.html#/s:.name: signalingServerError(message:code:)
Enums/TxError/ServerErrorReason.html#/s:.abstract: Any server signaling error. We get the message and code from the server

Enums/TxError/CallFailureReason.html#/s:.name: destinationNumberIsRequired
Enums/TxError/CallFailureReason.html#/s:.abstract: There’s no destination number when placing an outbound call

Enums/TxError/CallFailureReason.html#/s:.name: sessionIdIsRequired
Enums/TxError/CallFailureReason.html#/s:.abstract: Session Id is missing when starting a call. Check you’re logged in before starting a call.

Enums/TxError/ClientConfigurationFailure.name: userNameAndPasswordAreRequired
Enums/TxError/ClientConfigurationFailure.abstract: sip userand sip password are missing when using the USER / PASSWORD login method

Enums/TxError/ClientConfigurationFailure.name: userNameIsRequired
Enums/TxError/ClientConfigurationFailure.abstract: sip user is missing when using the USER / PASSWORD login method

Enums/TxError/ClientConfigurationFailure.name: passwordIsRequired
Enums/TxError/ClientConfigurationFailure.abstract: password is missing when using the USER / PASSWORD login method

Enums/TxError/ClientConfigurationFailure.name: tokenIsRequired
Enums/TxError/ClientConfigurationFailure.abstract: token is missing when using the Token login method.

Enums/TxError/SocketFailureReason.html#/.name: socketNotConnected
Enums/TxError/SocketFailureReason.html#/.abstract: Socket is not connected. Check that you have an active connection.

Enums/TxError/SocketFailureReason.html.name: SocketFailureReason
Enums/TxError/SocketFailureReason.html.abstract: The underlying reason of the Socket connection failure

Enums/TxError/ClientConfigurationFailure.name: ClientConfigurationFailureReason
Enums/TxError/ClientConfigurationFailure.abstract: The underlying reason of client setup configuration errors

Enums/TxError/CallFailureReason.html.name: CallFailureReason
Enums/TxError/CallFailureReason.html.abstract: The underlying reason of the call errors

Enums/TxError/ServerErrorReason.html.name: ServerErrorReason
Enums/TxError/ServerErrorReason.html.abstract: The underlying reason of the server errors

Enums/TxError.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC7TxError.name: clientConfigurationFailed(reason:)
Enums/TxError.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC7TxError.abstract: There’s an invalid parameter when setting up the SDK

Enums/TxError.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC7TxError.name: callFailed(reason:)
Enums/TxError.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC7TxError.abstract: There’s an invalid parameter when starting a call

Enums/TxError.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC7TxError.name: serverError(reason:)
Enums/TxError.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC7TxError.abstract: When the signaling server sends an error

Enums/TxError.html.name: TxError
Enums/TxError.html.abstract: TxError is the error type returned by Telnyx WebRTC SDK. It encompasses a few different types of errors, each with

Enums/CallState.html.name: CallState
Enums/CallState.html.abstract: CallState represents the state of the call

Classes/Call.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC4CallC8ca.name: callInfo
Classes/Call.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC4CallC8ca.abstract: TxCallInfo Contains the required information of the current Call.

Classes/Call.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC4CallC9ca.name: callState
Classes/Call.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC4CallC9ca.abstract: CallState The actual state of the Call.

Classes/Call.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC4CallC6an.name: answer()
Classes/Call.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC4CallC6an.abstract: Starts the process to answer the incoming call.

Classes/Call.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC4CallC9mu.name: muteAudio()
Classes/Call.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC4CallC9mu.abstract: Turns off audio output, i.e. makes it so other call participants cannot hear your audio.

Classes/Call.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC4CallC11u.name: unmuteAudio()
Classes/Call.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC4CallC11u.abstract: Turns on audio output, i.e. makes it so other call participants can hear your audio.

Classes/Call.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC4CallC10t.name: toggleHold()
Classes/Call.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC4CallC10t.abstract: Toggles between active and held state of the call.

Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.name: calls
Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.abstract: Keeps track of all the created calls by theirs UUIDs

Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.name: delegate
Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.abstract: Subscribe to TxClient delegate to receive Telnyx SDK events

Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.name: connect(txConfig:)
Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.abstract: Connects to the iOS client to the Telnyx signaling server using the desired login credentials.

Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.name: disconnect()
Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.abstract: Disconnects the TxClient from the Telnyx signaling server.

Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.name: isConnected()
Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.abstract: To check if TxClient is connected to Telnyx server.

Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.name: getSessionId()
Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.abstract: Get the current session ID after logging into Telnyx Backend.

Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.name: getCall(callId:)
Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.abstract: This function can be used to access any active call tracked by the SDK.

Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.name: newCall(callerName:callerNumber:destinationNumber:callId:clientState:)
Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.abstract: Creates a new Call and starts the call sequence, negotiate the ICE Candidates and sends the invite.

Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.name: setEarpiece()
Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.abstract: Select the internal earpiece as the audio output

Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.name: setSpeaker()
Classes/TxClient.html#/s:9TelnyxRTC8TxCl.abstract: Select the speaker as the audio output

Classes/TxClient.html.name: TxClient
Classes/TxClient.html.abstract: The TelnyxRTC client connects your application to the Telnyx backend,

Classes/Call.html.name: Call
Classes/Call.html.abstract: A Call is the representation of an audio or video call between two WebRTC Clients, SIP clients or phone numbers.
